channel.title: Overclocking i7 processor
channel.description: hi i got some questions for you guys is oveclocking dangerous? can i overclock my intel core i7-2670QM? and what does overclocking do? thanks for help

item.title: Overclocking i7 processor
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If it’s a laptop: you get what you are given. Do not overclock, do not attempt to install new components other than RAM or HDD as t4 stated.

Read full topic

item.title: Overclocking i7 processor
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:452719”][quote author=t4 link=topic=555595.msg4067714#msg4067714 date=1344049262]

I would honestly suggest taking it somewhere and having them do it for you, because if they break it. They owe you a new laptop. If you break it, you are screwed.

people don’t do this for that very reason
[/quote]while true they may replace it it’s quite rare actually. I’ve had old pc’s before that ( while were crap in the first place lol ) have been damaged before and they would replace just that specific hardware before they go replace the laptop[/quote]
replacement usually means REPLACING (same hardware). you also stated it was a PC (desktop), rather than a laptop.

Read full topic

[/quote]

But yes the lack of a dedicated graphics card is the problem.[/quote]

i’m not t4_, so i’m not a god at computers or anything… but a quick google got me some info:

find if your laptop is MXM-powered
if it is, find a nice little chip like this expired ebay item

item.title: Overclocking i7 processor
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote="…nerd123456789, post:1, topic:452719"]is oveclocking dangerous?
can i overclock my intel core i7-2670QM?
and what does overclocking do?
thanks for help[/quote]

Dangerous? No. Does it reduce the lifespan of your components? Yes. I’ve done it for a couple of years on my laptop graphics card and it’s been absolutely fine though, unless you desperately want your laptop to live for more than 6 years ish it’ll be fine.

Can you overclock? Don’t the i core processors still have turboboost functionality built in? If so, just use that.

Overclocking increases the clock speed (calculations per second) that your processors operates at, you probably won’t notice a significant difference unless you’re doing something very intensive… what is it that you’re doing that you require more power for?

Aff:

maybe instead of fucking up your i7, you should save some money to get a better GPU to fix your original problem

Good luck installing a new gpu in a laptop
But yes the lack of a dedicated graphics card is the problem.

Read full topic
